intro: Heteropterys ayacuchensis, commonly known as the Ayacuchensis tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in cloud forests. The tree is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
